 * Review a variety of areas including operations, purchasing, inventory, distribution and facilities.
 * Work with accounting to review, strategize and implement appropriate actions to optimize inventory levels and turns.

 * Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement.

This list is not to be considered comprehensive and WireMasters Management retains the right to modify the contents of this document at any time. Other duties may be assigned by WireMasters Management.

 * Software Design and Software Maintenance.
 * Teamwork, work well under pressure.
 * Self-motivated and organized.
 * Math Aptitude.
 * Analysis.

description:
Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and visualization to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions. You will work closely with various departments to understand their data needs and help them achieve their goals through effective reporting and analysis.

While your scope will cover multiple business units, your focus will be on insights for our Sales Organization. Previous experience in Sales Operations roles could be useful.

Duties

 * Build and maintain reporting to drive business insights including market analysis, future product opportunities, key customer data, etc.
 * Develop and maintain interactive dashboards using tools such as Power BI and Tableau to visualize key performance indicators.
 * Conduct thorough business analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications for database design.
 * Utilize SQL for querying databases and extracting relevant data for analysis.
 * Use Python for data manipulation, automation, and advanced analytics tasks.
 * Manage projects effectively, ensuring timely delivery of insights and reports.
 * Present findings and recommendations to management in a clear and concise manner.

Requirements

 * Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, Tableau, SQL, and Python is essential.
 * Strong understanding of database design principles.
 * Experience with business analysis methodologies and project management practices.
 * Ability to analyze complex datasets and vaticinate future trends based on historical data.
 * Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
 * A proactive approach to problem-solving with a strong attention to detail.
 * Previous experience in a similar role is a plus but not mandatory.

Join us in harnessing the power of data to drive strategic decisions!

About EZ Solar Products:

EZ Solar Products' mission is to make solar simple with innovative products that are high-quality, installer-friendly, and cost-effective. With a solution for any install, EZ Solar junction boxes and wire management solutions are built to last for life and come with a 25-year warranty. With an incredible team and tons of growth, this is an opportunity to join a company that's changing the industry and making a difference for the planet.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst

description:
About Zipline

Zipline is on a mission to transform the way goods move. Our aim is to solve the world’s most urgent and complex access challenges by building the first instant logistics system that serves all humans equally. Leveraging expertise in robotics and autonomy, Zipline designs, builds, and operates a fleet of cutting edge, autonomous delivery drones. We serve tens of millions of people around the world.

Joining Zipline’s Emerging Talent program as an intern is an opportunity to contribute to our promise of building a system that provides equitable access to critical healthcare supplies for millions of people. We believe that internships are more than just opportunities to learn by watching or doing low level tasks. We expect our interns to take on meaningful work that actively contributes to moving Zipline’s mission forward, while learning real-world skills that will serve them in their careers for the long term.

Join us, and build the future of logistics with the best humans around!

About The Application Software Team

Zipline’s Application Software team builds the tools we use to run our business. We are responsible for the operating system of Zipline – we develop critical applications that enable the manufacturing, maintenance, and service of our drone delivery system. We’re currently creating and improving systems to optimize operations across the business, including within finance, supply chain, inventory, manufacturing, maintenance, and engineering. We also build the software applications that enable the Zipline fulfillment experience, ranging from customer-facing applications for placing orders and tracking deliveries to internal applications for managing inventory and shipping orders.

The Role

As a data analytics intern on our team, you’ll partner with stakeholders, product managers, and software engineers to uncover meaningful insights about our business.Your primary focus will be designing and building dashboards and reports that empower decision-making and improve operational efficiency. This role is ideal for someone passionate about data, problem-solving, and driving impactful outcomes through analytics.

What You'll Do


 * Collaborate across operations, finance, and customer success teams to understand and prioritize business needs
 * Partner with software and analytics engineers to understand the data generated by our applications, and how it is transformed to be analytics-ready
 * Design, develop, and maintain dashboards and reports that provide clear insights via key business metrics
 * Work with the team to automate and optimize reporting processes to make data readily and easily available to drive insights
 * Support data quality efforts by validating datasets and ensuring accuracy in reporting
   
   
   

What You'll Bring


 * Experience writing SQL queries to calculate metrics and generate insights
 * Experience performing data analysis on large datasets
 * Experience building dashboards in business intelligence tools such as Mode, Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
 * Adept at summarizing large datasets visually to make complex results understandable at a glance
 * Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions
   
   
   

Our internships are full-time positions, in-person at our South San Francisco office. We will host our Summer 2025 interns from May to August.

The starting cash range for this role is $38 - 42 / hour. Please note that this is a target, starting cash range for a candidate who meets the minimum qualifications for this role. The final cash pay for this role will depend on a variety of factors, including a specific candidate's experience, qualifications, skills, and working location. The total compensation package for this role may also include: overtime pay; commuter benefits; paid sick time; and more.

Zipline is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws or our own sensibilities.

We value diversity at Zipline and welcome applications from those who are traditionally underrepresented in tech. If you like the sound of this position but are not sure if you are the perfect fit, please apply!

Zipline is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your point of contact at Zipline know if you require any accommodations throughout your interview process.
sector: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
title: Data Analytics Intern (Summer 2025)

description:
What Makes a Honda, Is Who Makes a Honda

Honda has a clear vision for the future, and it’s a joyful one. We are looking for individuals with the skills, courage, persistence, and dreams that will help us reach our future-focused goals. At our core is innovation. Honda is constantly innovating and developing solutions to drive our business with record success. We strive to be a company that serves as a source of “power” that supports people around the world who are trying to do things based on their own initiative and that helps people expand their own potential. To this end, Honda strives to realize “the joy and freedom of mobility” by developing new technologies and an innovative approach to achieve a “zero environmental footprint.”

We are looking for qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences, continuous improvement values, and a strong work ethic to join our team.

If your goals and values align with Honda’s, we want you to join our team to Bring the Future!

Job Purpose

The Senior Data Analyst in Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) is responsible for driving strategic decision-making by developing and implementing advanced data analytics solutions to uncover actionable insights from complex financial data. This includes bringing new data solution ideas, conducting in-depth financial analysis, and communicating findings to key stakeholders in a clear and impactful manner.

Candidate has to be located in either Los Angeles, California or Marysville, Ohio

Key Accountabilities


 * Data Analytics: Conduct in-depth data analysis on AHM financial planning/budget data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement, translating findings into actionable recommendations using SAP (BPC) and other system tools such as Power BI, dashboard. Monitor and analyse financial performance against targets thru data solution, providing insights and recommendations to optimize resource allocation.
 * Budget Event Support: BPC system operational support for budget events. Identify opportunities to streamline financial processes and automate reporting to improve efficiency and accuracy for peer financial analysts.
 * Data Governance: Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and security by implementing appropriate data management practices.
 * Ad-hoc Project and Analysis: Support the organization thru ad-hoc project and financial analysis as needed to address specific business questions.
 * Presentation and Communication: Effectively communicate complex financial information to both technical and non-technical audiences through clear and concise presentations.
   
   

Qualifications, Experience, And Skills


 * Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, Statistics, or related field.
 * Advanced degree (Master's or MBA) in a relevant field preferred.
 * Professional certifications (e.g. CPA) desirable.
 * Minimum of 3-5 years of progressive experience in accounting and/or financial analysis.
 * Experience in financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting.
 * Strong understanding of financial accounting principles and reporting standards.
 * Experience in data management, including data cleaning, transformation, and visualization preferred.
 * Advanced proficiency in Excel, SQL, and statistical software (e.g., Python, R), experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) and experience in ERP system (e.g., SAP – ECC/BPC)
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the ability to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in data.
 * Ability to understand the business context and translate financial data into actionable insights.
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present complex financial information to non-financial audiences.
 * Project management skills to manage multiple tasks and deadlines effectively.
   
   

Workstyle


 * Hybrid
   
   

What differentiates Honda and make us an employer of choice?

Total Rewards


 * Competitive Base Salary (pay will be based on several variables that include, but not limited to geographic location, work experience, etc.)
 * Paid Overtime
 * Regional Bonus (when applicable)
 * Industry-leading Benefit Plans (Medical, Dental, Vision, Rx)
 * Paid time off, including vacation, holidays, shutdown
 * Company Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
 * 401K Plan with company match + additional contribution
   
   

Career Growth


 * Advancement Opportunities
 * Career Mobility
 * Education Reimbursement for Continued Learning
 * Training and Development Programs
   
   

Additional Offerings


 * Tuition Assistance & Student Loan Repayment
 * Lifestyle Account
 * Childcare Reimbursement Account
 * Elder Care Support
 * Wellbeing Program
 * Community Service and Engagement Programs
 * Product Programs
 * Free Drinks Onsite
   
   

Honda is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.
title: Data Analyst, Financial Planning and Analysis

Port Hueneme, CA

About Us

JSL Technologies, Inc. (JSL) is a certified Small Disadvantaged Business (SDB) and Veteran-Owned Government Contractor providing Engineering, Logistics, and Program Support Services to the Department of Defense (DoD). Our team of over 350 employees is committed to delivering practical, innovative, and affordable solutions. We are headquartered in Oxnard, CA, and provide top-tier services across the nation. JSL fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed, and highly accomplished professionals who respect each other, hold themselves accountable, and continually strive for improvement. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package.

Job Description

As a JSL Data Science Analyst you will be interpreting data for management to make informed decisions. We are looking for an energetic candidate who works well with a team of diverse individuals. You will be analyzing data and preparing results in different formats.

Minimum Qualifications


 * Ability to obtain a U.S Secret Security Clearance
 * Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future
 * Bachelor's degree
 * General Microsoft suite skills
 * Database experience, Tableau, Access, Power BI
 * Analyst experience
 * Willingness to learn
 * Ability to compile data into reports/presentations for presenting to a group.
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * STEM degree
 * Secret Clearance
 * Familiarity with Navy identified systems (i.e. JIRA, Advana Jupiter, Tableau, Python, OPUS, SIMLOX, Block SIM, R, and other
 * NAVY analyst experience
   
   

Security Clearance

Applicants must have an active security clearance and/or the ability to obtain and maintain a US Government Security Clearance. Selected candidates will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements to obtain a DoD Government- granted security clearance. Individuals will be subject to a background investigation to include but not limited to, criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.

Eeo

JSL Technologies, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants are considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed must be representative of the knowledge, skills, minimum education, training, licensure, experience, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

title: Data Science Analyst (Entry Level)

description:
DUTIES


 * Interpret data, formulate reports, and make recommendations based upon the research findings
 * Design and support data visualizations, including dashboards
 * Apply descriptive statistical analysis to data
 * Create, document, and implement quality control procedures that eliminate data errors
 * Gather data sources to address data issues identified by internal and external reviews
 * Prepare and deliver presentations, reports, recommendations, or alternatives for improving processes in operational models and workflow procedures
 * Create or update documents required as part of business and functional requirements
 * Conduct routine ad hoc data runs and prepare write-ups in response to data queries
 * Revise processing operations to incorporate new data elements and data quality control and timeliness procedures related to new elements
 * Provide technical support as necessary
   
   

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS


 * Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or a relevant field, plus a minimum of 3+ years' experience in a business analyst or data analyst role
 * Experience using Excel and SQL, SAS, or other programming languages to query and summarize data from extracts or large databases for generating reports and to aid decision-making
 * Data visualization experience using dashboards in Excel, Tableau, Power BI, etc.
 * Experience developing business process models and workflow diagrams
 * Advanced Excel skills (task automation; dynamic reports with PivotTables; building formulae; cell formatting; building charts and graphs; large data management with IF, SUM, INDEX, MATCH, VLOOKUP functions)
 * Familiarity with one or more programming languages (e.g., SAS, Python, R)
 * Strong problem-solving skills
 * Strong written and verbal communications skills
   
   

PREFERED QUALIFICATIONS


 * Experience with Atlassian products Jira and Confluence
 * Experience with Agile development processes
 * Experience maintaining relational databases using SQL
 * Certification in one or more programming languages (e.g., SAS, Python, R)
 * Strong proficiency with MS Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, and Outlook) to create complex documents, manage schedules, and analyze data
 * Effective organizational, planning, and time-management skills
 * Experience with claims data or health information management
   
   

Salary Range: $55 - $65 per hourFor a complete listing of benefits, please visit our careers page at www.hendall.com/careersHendall Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

description:
Join Refonte (Refonte AI) Data Analytics Internship Program!

Refonte (Refonte AI) is a globally recognized IT and Ed-tech leader committed to innovation, excellence, and empowering aspiring data analytics professionals worldwide. We specialize in digital marketing, data science, data analytics, UI/UX design, web development, and app development, driving impactful solutions across diverse industries. Now, we’re offering a unique opportunity for ambitious individuals to master data analytics through hands-on experience in real-world projects with a global team.




🌐 Explore more about us here: https://refontelearning.com/




Position: Data Analytics Training and Intern | Location: Remote, USA




Who Should Apply?

If you’re passionate about data analytics, eager to learn from industry experts, and looking to gain practical experience in a flexible, collaborative environment, this internship is for you! Join a global team spanning Oceania, Asia, Europe, and the Americas and work on real data analytics projects that will build your skills from foundational to advanced levels.




Projects You’ll Work On:

 * Excel Data Visualization: Visualize a hospital dataset using Excel for impactful insights.
 * Statistical Analysis: Analyze live stock price data to explore company performance.
 * Risk Analytics Case Study: Conduct exploratory data analysis to minimize lending risk.
 * Bike-Sharing System Study: Analyze data on bike-sharing trends and usage patterns.
 * IPL Data Analysis: Dive into Indian Premier League cricket data for analytical insights.
 * Data Communication: Present key findings and insights for decision-making.
 * Global Movie Release Strategy: Collaborate on a strategic global release for RSVP Movies in 2024.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Collaborate with data science experts to collect, clean, and analyze diverse datasets, enhancing your skills in data preprocessing and visualization.
 * Utilize machine learning and data mining techniques to uncover insights, including Excel interface structuring and more.
 * Apply Python programming for Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) in real business contexts, focusing on risk analytics in banking and finance.
 * Design tests, optimize model performance, and explore no-code database solutions for enhanced data processing.
 * Contribute to building machine learning pipelines for applications across commerce, finance, and more.
 * Work closely with internal teams to explore business data, test hypotheses, and assess the impact of strategies using statistical methods.
 * Develop innovative solutions using modeling technologies and tackle challenges in areas like bike-share systems.
 * Gain proficiency in Tableau and other tools for complex data visualizations.
 * Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate your analytical processes and insights effectively.




What We’re Looking For:

 * Education: Pursuing a degree that demonstrates your commitment to continuous learning in data analytics or a related field.
 * Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal skills are essential for collaborating effectively and presenting complex ideas clearly.
 * Teamwork & Independence: Ability to work independently and as a collaborative team member, demonstrating adaptability and teamwork skills.




Why Join Us? This is more than just an internship; it's an opportunity to build a solid foundation in data analytics, gain practical skills with real data, and grow your network with professionals from around the globe. By the end of the program, you’ll be prepared to excel in data analytics roles across various industries.




Application Process: Upon applying, our team will reach out with the next steps and joining instructions.




🌐 Learn More: https://refontelearning.com/




Location: Remote, USA




Ready to Launch Your Career in Data Analytics? Start your journey with Refonte AI and develop the skills that will define the future of data analytics

description:
Day-to-Day Responsibilities




Impact Staffing International (ISI) is looking for a skilled Data Analyst (Aviation Analytics) with 5+ years of professional experience in market research and analysis, trade development or quantitative analysis, based in Irving, Texas. The Data Analyst (Aviation Analytics) plays a pivotal role in forecasting air service route traffic and revenue, utilizing QSI models to interpret results and assess the profit potential of various routes. This position involves troubleshooting forecasting issues by adjusting assumptions and methodologies based on feedback. This role will lead both short-term and long-term forecasting efforts for passengers, landed weights, and operations, contributing to the annual budget and other projections. This position will develop compelling business cases for airline executives, incorporating forecast data when appropriate, and perform statistical and financial analyses to support the passenger development plan. The Data Analyst (Aviation Analytics) role includes market research to identify underserved and emerging markets, recommending strategies to enhance DFW’s market position. This role collaborates with Revenue Management, Finance, and other departments to support budget processes and performance reporting. Additionally, this position will organize trade statistics, airport data, and research findings into clear narrative and graphic reports for airport management while assisting with special projects as needed. This position is a hybrid contract-to-hire role, going in the office 4 days each week.




Required Skills and Background:




 * Bachelor's degree in marketing, international business, finance/economics, statistics, data science, aviation management or a related field.
 * Five (5) years of experience in market research and analysis, trade development or quantitative analysis.
 * Airline industry knowledge
 * Data analytic skills and background (predictive modeling and forecasting preferred)
 * Any equivalent combination of education and/or experience may QSIbe substituted for the above.




Preferred Qualifications:




 * Strong statistical, forecasting, and analytical skills
 * Experience in Tableau, QSI model and forecasting
 * Knowledge of international business and/or airline industry.
 * Master of Business Administration degree.




Client Benefits Include:




 * Health, dental, and medical insurance
 * 401(K)
 * Weekly pay
 * Amazing company culture

description:
The DSS Accountability Office’s ORCA is charged with working closely with internal and external partners to ensure that DHS facilities, directly-managed and those managed by provider agencies, comply with statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations governing the provision of shelter in New York City. ORCA carries out its mission through collaboration with Agency personnel to develop initiatives that optimize the Agency’s resources to comply with regulatory requirements.

The Office Of Regulatory Compliance & Accountability (ORCA) Is Recruiting For (1) One City Research Scientist II To Function As a Data Research Analyst, Who Will


 * Provide analytical support in the areas of data reporting, data analysis, and internal audits for special projects created and designed to enhance the operational and administrative activities of HRA regarding program accountability and integrity.
 * Assume responsibility for all aspects of project management and data analysis regarding integrity concerns, including the research and development of innovative methods of data mining that will identify integrity and fraud issues for all of HRA.
 * Conduct internal ad hoc inquiries into HRA's various source systems and analyzing quantitative I qualitative data to locate vulnerabilities within the agency; providing proposals and suggestions to improve HRA's overall accountability and integrity.
 * Assist with the creation and implementation of data mining for AO. Perform trend analysis and prepare reports on trends. Maintain consistency and integrity of data collection; report concerns regarding data integrity.
 * Provide analytical support to the Director ORCA and other program areas under the Accountability Office umbrella in the areas of data reporting, data analysis, and internal audits.
 * Understand and document project-specific source access mechanisms, detailed data flow and related transformation to specific targets. Assist with the design of alternative approaches for effective data integration.
   
   

Minimum Qualifications


 * For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.
   
   

To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have:


 * A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or
 * A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or
 * Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above.
   
   

Note

Probationary Period

Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year.

Preferred Skills


 * Proficiency with a statistical software package such as R, SAS, Stata, MATLAB or SPSS. - Experience using Excel to clean, match, and analyze very large data sets. - Experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing data from large databases. - Strong organizational skills. - Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. - Programming experience a plus.
   
   

Residency Requirement

New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

Additional Information

The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.
title: DATA RESEARCH ANALYST

description:
Concord isn't your typical consulting firm; we are an execution company with a passion for making things happen. Our mission is to help clients enhance customer experiences, optimize operations, and revolutionize their product offerings through seamless integration, optimization, and activation of technology and data.




This role is for a highly skilled BI Analyst with Cognos Analytics expertise who will play a key role in our data-driven decision-making. You'll be responsible for the entire data journey, from building data pipelines and data models to creating insightful reports and dashboards using Cognos, with a focus on financial data and operational metrics.




What you will be doing

 * Design and develop robust SQL queries to extract and transform data for reporting and visualization.
 * Create sophisticated reports and dashboards in Cognos Analytics, ensuring clarity and alignment with client objectives.
 * Build and maintain data architecture, ensuring optimal performance of queries, pipelines, and automation workflows.
 * Analyze data quality and identify discrepancies between available data and reporting needs, providing actionable insights for stakeholders.
 * Develop and implement data transformation processes (ETL) using tools like Databricks or Alteryx.
 * Leverage cloud-based data solutions like AWS, Snowflake, Azure, or Google Cloud to support scalable and efficient data management.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to design and execute data strategies, with a focus on financial metrics and operational analytics.




What we are looking for

 * Extensive experience with Cognos Analytics including report building, dashboard design, and optimization for performance.
 * Finance experience preferred, including familiarity with financial reporting, budgeting, and forecasting processes.
 * Advanced SQL skills with the ability to write complex queries and optimize performance.
 * Proven experience developing and implementing ETL pipelines using tools like Databricks and/or Alteryx.
 * Familiarity with cloud-based data solutions such as AWS, Snowflake, Azure, or Google Cloud.
 * Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Python) to automate data processes is a plus.
 * Experience with relational database systems (e.g., Redshift, BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, or MySQL).




Job specifications

 * Employment type: full-time employment with Concord.
 * Work arrangement: hybrid-flex (1-2 days on-site, but flexible). Open to remote candidates based outside of KC.
 * Office location: Parkville, MO.
 * Interview process: (1) introductory call, (2) take-home assessment, and (3) panel interview with the hiring team.
 * Requirements: Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship, now or in the future.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Cognos Analytics

description:
Open to remote work except in South Dakota, Vermont and West Virginia.



The annual base salary for this position ranges from $99,500.00 in our lowest geographic market to $222,900.00 in our highest geographic market. Actual salary will vary based on a candidate's location, qualifications, skills and experience.



Information About Benefits Can Be Found Here.



Who We Are Looking For



Converse is the story of a sneaker that started on the court and moved to the stage and the streets. We’re a company ready for change and that’s who we hire: the most malleable, the most innovative, and the most creative. Our clothes and sneakers have been worn by rebels, rockers, rappers, artists, thinkers, and individuals. So that’s why we hire individuals.



Converse is looking for a seasoned Digital Media and Marketing Analytics Professional with expertise in ROI Measurement (MTA / MMM), Campaign Test & Learn, Audience Selection and Segmentation, DMP / CDP and web platform measurement. We want someone who can be a player/coach in our Marketing Analytics function collaborating with our global and geography partners.



What You Will Work On





 * Partner with internal stakeholders & decision-makers to evaluate business objectives, and propose analytical data solutions that deliver meaningful insights
 * Utilizing data sources to understand our customers purchasing patterns, with the goal of providing insights to inform new marketing strategies
 * Manage the relationship with tech partners and act as primary point of connect when recommending new use-cases
 * Serve as primary CDP lead, onboarding new users to the tool and providing regular platform maintenance
 * Develop and perform quality checks on data for both ad hoc and ongoing processes.
   
   



Qualifications





 * 5+ years of experience in data analytics, digital marketing and/or mar-tech platforms leveraging data and insights to drive recommendations preferred
 * Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a technology or, Marketing, Business or Economics
 * Strong understanding of CDP and DMP platforms (Segment, Tealium Audience Stream, Adobe Audience Manager, etc.)
 * Passion and experience with data-based decision-making processes, with a strong emphasis on marketing performance analytics & optimization
 * Expertise with Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics and tag management tools
 * Understanding of how to use digital media, performance marketing and emerging channels such as paid search (Google ads), paid social (Facebook, Instagram ads), email, affiliates etc. to drive customer acquisition and retention
 * Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint
 * Experience in SQL
 * Positive demeanor and willingness to learn new things
 * Experience in SQL
   
   



We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees and job applicants. We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.
title: Global Digital Marketing Analyst (Data Analytics- Remote Option)

description:
Job Description

Position Title: Data Analyst

Reports to: Chief Community Investment Officer

Classification: Exempt

WRK Group Overview

REACH serves as the community quarterback for comprehensive community revitalization in the Riverside neighborhood, located in northeast Wilmington, DE.  REACH supports and leverages efforts and resources which promote upward economic mobility for Riverside residents. Employing the Purpose-Built Communities’ model, the revitalization focuses on three pillars: 1) redevelopment including high-quality, mixed-income housing, 2) a cradle to college and career readiness pipeline, and 3) community health, wellness, and safety initiatives. REACH, in collaboration with service partners Kingswood Community Center and The Warehouse (an innovative teen center with more than 150 partner organizations) work together to transform Riverside into a robust, healthy, and vibrant community. The Warehouse, REACH Riverside and Kingswood Community Center are collectively known as the "WRK Group".

Position Summary

This position is responsible for collecting and interpreting data to help the organization take actionable steps to improve performance and meet goals This includes gathering information and statistics, building charts and graphs to present results to leadership and finding ways to improve organizational efficiencies using gathered data.

Essential Functions

Data Collection and Preparation


 * Collect, interpret, and analyze data using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
 * Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
 * Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
   
   

Data Analysis and Interpretation


 * Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
 * Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct problems.
 * Use statistical techniques to generate insights and answer business questions.
   
   

Reporting and Visualization


 * Create clear, concise, and visually appealing reports, dashboards, and presentations.
 * Use tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Excel to communicate findings effectively.
   
   

Collaboration with Stakeholders


 * Work with business teams to understand their data needs and objectives.
 * Translate business requirements into analytical tasks and deliver actionable insights.
   
   

Performance Monitoring and Optimization


 * Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics.
 * Provide recommendations for process improvements and strategic decisions based on data insights.
   
   

Data Governance and Compliance


 * Maintain compliance with policies, procedures, and regulations governing state/federal contracts and other funders.
   
   

Predictive Modeling and Forecasting


 * Create presentations and reports using graphs, infographics, and other methods to visualize data.
 * Develop predictive models and forecasts to support future planning.
 * Use machine learning algorithms for advanced analytics, if required.
   
   

Ad Hoc Analysis


 * Identify and define new opportunities for data improvement.
 * Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
 * Work directly with leadership, managers, and partners to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships.
   
   

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Skills And Abilities

The incumbent must be able to:


 * Proficiently utilize Microsoft Office suite, database management and graphics applications (i.e., Adobe, Photoshop, Publisher, and CRM software.)
 * Demonstrate strong analytical skill with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate substantial amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
 * Be adept at queries, report writing with the ability to present findings in a compelling and easy to understand manner.
 * Self-start a project or a task, with a high level of initiative, and be a proven proactive thinker who thrives in a dynamic and matrixed environment.
 * Exercise initiative and sound judgment in analyzing complex issues and problems, identify, and evaluate alternative solutions, project consequences of proposed actions, and implement recommendations in support of goals.
 * Express ideas, concepts, and technical information clearly and concisely, both in writing and orally.
 * Manage multiple projects with a strong attention to detail and have organization and effective time management skills.
 * Analyze complex issues and problems, identify, and evaluate alternative solutions, project consequences of proposed actions, and implement recommendations in support of goals.
 * Work with shared leadership and in cross-functional teams.
 * Operate as a team player.
 * Adapt to change and demonstrate flexibility as workstreams shift.
 * Maintain confidentiality.
   
   

Education And Experience 


 * BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
 * At least 3 years working as a Data Analyst with demonstrated experience with data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
 * Proficiency in statistics and experience using statistical software for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
   
   

Supervisory Responsibility

None

Position Type and Expected Hours of Work 

This is a full-time position with varying hours of work: Monday through Friday, 8:30 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. This position may require after-hours and weekend work.

Travel

Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.

Conditions of Hire


 * A satisfactory criminal background, education verification and reference check.
 * Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.
   
   

Failure to meet these requirements may result in an employment offer being withdrawn. 

Physical Tasks And Working Conditions


 * Office and classroom work requires sitting for extended periods of time.
 * Using a computer, keyboard, and screen, as well as teaching tools (whiteboard, projector, etc.)
 * Must be able to move about to facilitate workshops, access files, operate equipment and office machinery.
 * Must be able to withstand different environmental conditions, including outdoor conditions, extreme heat and/or cold, and loud noise level.
 * Must have the ability to focus while working under environmental conditions.
 * Must have full use of peripheral vision, distance vision, and depth perception.
 * Must have mobility, vision, hearing, and dexterity levels appropriate to the duties to be performed.
   
   

The physical demands described in the job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Equipment Use

Telephone, copier/scanner, computer/laptop (Microsoft Office Applications), tablet and fax machine.

Mental Demands

Solve problems, make decisions, exercise sound judgment, interpret data, organize, write, plan, prioritize, communicate clearly, de-escalate situations, model respectful non-abusive behavior, critical thinking, critical reasoning, attention to detail, ability to recall, coordinate schedules, work as a member of a team, and speak in public.

Evaluation of Performance

Performance in this position will be evaluated in accordance with the Employee Handbook.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

The Warehouse is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, age, veteran status, or any other status protected under local, state, or federal laws.

description:

Opportunity to work with Fortune 500 Companies
title: Junior Data Analyst

description:
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), one of the world’s leading financial groups. Across the globe, we’re 120,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.

With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.

Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.

The selected colleague will work at an MUFG office or client sites four days per week and work remotely one day. A member of our recruitment team will provide more details.

Job Summary

Working as a member of the Office of the Chief Data Officer (OCDO), Enterprise Data Quality Team (EDQ), responsible for enabling the efficient and actionable use of data by planning, developing, and implementing enterprise data controls across systems within the Bank with a focus on Risk and Regulatory Reporting under the Data Management Integrated Control Framework (DMICF). Acting as Golden Source Identification and Certification (GSIC) Data Quality Analyst for Agile systems development lifecycle projects, work with a broad range of teams and roles across the organization including teams such as Office of the Chief Data Officer, Americas Risk Management, and Regulatory Reporting as well as roles such as Report Content Owners, Business System Owners, System Managers, project business sponsors, business and technical Subject Matter Expert resources within multiple MUFG entities, project manager, project leads, and IT. This role will further support Data Quality Leads with data analysis, support onboarding efforts for new control points, and support any ongoing monthly collection and reporting process.

Key Responsibilities


 * Implement control structures to ensure the accuracy and quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels
 * Maintain the data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to our policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools, and data architecture
 * Ensure that data-related business requirements for protecting sensitive data are communicated, well understood, considered as part of operational prioritization and planning
 * Participate in and contribute to data source identification (lineage), data mapping, functional design and detail design
 * Support Root Cause Analysis / investigation activities and document results
 * Ensure adherence to enterprise data standards, quality, and monitoring processes
 * Support project documentation reviews and testing activities at all levels to include reviews of test plans, test cases, and test scripts; triage and support fixes as necessary.
 * Identify gaps between current capabilities and new requirements, document design improvements, etc.
 * Determine data domains, identify in scope key data elements, assessment of rules required and expected.
 * Defining data quality rules across dimensions that data must conform to.
 * Identify and recommend new ways to streamline business processes
 * Research, analyze, and interpret source data as necessary to fulfill business requirements
 * Implement control structures to ensure the accuracy and quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels
 * Maintain the data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to our policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools, and data architecture
 * Ensure that data-related business requirements for protecting sensitive data are communicated, well understood, considered as part of operational prioritization and planning Work with business partners to provide reports as directed
 * Participate in and contribute to data source identification (lineage), data mapping, functional design and detail design
 * Ensure adherence to enterprise data standards, quality, and monitoring processes
 * Support project documentation reviews and testing activities at all levels to include reviews of test plans, test cases, and test scripts; triage and support fixes as necessary.
 * Identify gaps between current capabilities and new requirements, document design improvements, etc.
 * Understand and apply familiarity with Risk and Regulatory Reporting processes and Enterprise Metadata concepts such as Key Data Elements, Business Information Model, Report Attributes, Data Attributes, Physical Location, etc.
 * Performing data analysis including data extraction with standard SQL Tools.
 * Writing and executing queries to profile large data sets.
 * Support creation of various project related documentation (including but not limited to BRDs, DRDs, Test plans, Test Scripts, etc.)
   
   

Education


 * Degree or equivalent work experience equally preferable
   
   

Work Experience/Functional Skills


 * Some data quality or similar level data analysis experience required
 * Experience in the banking or finance institutions preferred
 * Knowledge of industry leading data quality and data protection management practices
 * Knowledge of data-related government regulatory requirements and emerging trends and issues
 * Knowledge of risk data architecture and technology solutions
 * Knowledge of relevant laws, legal codes, government regulations, agency rules, and current industry practices
 * Knowledge of computer software, including relevant applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
 * Experience with formulation of business analytics
 * Familiar with database management tools (e.g., Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server)
 * Familiar with data modeling tools
 * Familiar with data visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Collibra Data Quality)
 * Ability to design processes that make up a data system, and influence engineering and product directions
 * Ability to interact with external database administrators, data engineers, product managers, business stakeholders, and technology leaders
 * Ability to analyze large datasets
 * Ability to write high level technical specifications and comprehensive reports
   
   

Technical Skills


 * Data Analysis, Data Query skills, Data Science
 * Tableau, Alteryx or any other BI tool
 * SQL, Python
 * Amazon Web Services a plus
 * Collibra Data Quality a plus
 * Excel Macro a plus
   
   

The typical base pay range for this role is between $89K - $9K depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and location. This role may also be eligible for certain discretionary performance-based bonus and/or incentive compensation. Additionally, our Total Rewards program provides colleagues with a competitive benefits package (in accordance with the eligibility requirements and respective terms of each) that includes comprehensive health and wellness benefits, retirement plans, educational assistance and training programs, income replacement for qualified employees with disabilities, paid maternity and parental bonding leave, and paid vacation, sick days, and holidays. For more information on our Total Rewards package, please click the link below.

MUFG Benefits Summary

We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws (including (i) the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, (ii) the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, (iii) the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, and (iv) the California Fair Chance Act) to the extent that (a) an applicant is not subject to a statutory disqualification pursuant to Section 3(a)(39) of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934 or Section 8a(2) or 8a(3) of the Commodity Exchange Act, and (b) they do not conflict with the background screening requirements of the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) and the National Futures Association (NFA). title: Data Analyst

description:
About Dune

Dune is on a mission to make crypto data accessible. We’re a collaborative multi-chain analytics platform used by thousands of developers, analysts, & investors to understand the on-chain world and the frontiers of finance. We’re a team of ~50 employees, working together across Europe and eastern US timezones 🌍️. We believe in our mission, and in building a powerful, open product that allows individuals and communities to do deep research into important ecosystems like Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and many more.

We’re backed by some of the world's best investors. In February 2022, we announced our Series B funding round led by Coatue and Union Square Ventures, an important milestone that allowed us to double down on our mission. We’re using the funds to educate, reward and empower a new generation of onchain analysts aka Wizards 🧙‍♀️

If you want to have one of the highest impact jobs on the planet, come join our wonderful team of Galaxy brains.

Learn more about us:

The Dune Manifesto

Dune's Vision

Values and working at Dune

Meet the team

Role Overview

We are seeking a Data Content Creator to transform onchain data into engaging, impactful content and stories. By analyzing dashboards and trends, this role makes complex insights accessible through content such as daily tweets, bi-weekly emails, quarterly reports, and longer-form research. As part of Dune’s marketing strategy, the Data Content Creator will drive engagement, expand reach, and collaborate with partners and the Dune community on content opportunities.

This is a remote role for candidates based in the US East Coast (EST) or Europe West (GMT or CEST). Applications from other time zones or locations will not be considered.

Key Responsibilities


 * Translate onchain data and dashboards into concise, engaging content for various formats (tweets, newsletters, reports), and work with the marketing team to share and publicize the insights accordingly.
 * React quickly to market events, creating timely, data-driven content that aligns with trends.
 * Develop in-depth research reports on blockchains, ecosystems, developer activity, or specific sectors.
 * Build Dune dashboards to support and enhance content creation.
 * Collaborate and work with partners and the Dune Wizard community to identify and execute content opportunities.
   
   

Minimum Requirements


 * Strong experience with onchain data and analytics platforms
 * Proven ability to create diverse content formats, from short posts to detailed research reports.
 * Knowledge of blockchain ecosystems, developer activity, and market trends in crypto.
 * Excellent communication and storytelling skills with a data-driven mindset.
 * Experience building Dune dashboards or working with data visualization tools is a plus.
 * Based in the US East Coast (EST) or Europe West (GMT or CEST).
   
   

Perks And Benefits


 * A competitive salary and equity package 🚀. Both salary and equity is top 25% of companies in the space
 * Our employee equity scheme has world-class employee-friendly terms with a heavily discounted strike price (~90%) and a 10-year exercise window
 * 🏖 5 weeks PTO + local public holidays (that can be swapped to suit you)
 * 🧑‍💻 A fully remote-first approach within a distributed team with flexible working hours; you structure your own day
 * Say goodbye to meeting overload! We believe in a healthy mix of async and sync work, so you can focus on what truly matters—no more wasted time on endless meetings!
 * Good health is important, so we offer private medical insurance, dental & vision as standard 🩺
 * We believe in paid parental leave 👶 to help you celebrate this important milestone, transition to your new life, and bond with your new baby. We offer 16 weeks to primary caregivers and 6 weeks to secondary caregivers, fully paid. Plus a 2-week part-time phased return at full pay to help you get used to your new (and slightly more complex!) schedule
 * Quarterly offsites in various exciting locations as a company or team to connect, work together and have fun (so far in Tuscany 🇮🇹 Berlin 🇩🇪 Austria 🇦🇹and Athens 🇬🇷).
 * On top of this 👆each person gets a yearly travel allowance to connect and co-work with someone or a team of people for a few days.
 * An allowance for your at-home setup, to ensure you are happy, comfortable and productive. If you prefer a local co-working space, we’ll pay for your desk.
 * Work with some of the best people you’ll ever get to meet!
 * And of course, you get some awesome Dune swag! ✌️😎
   
   

We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
title: Data Content Creator

description:
About Transdev

Cities, counties, airports, companies, and universities across the U.S. contract with Transdev to operate their transportation systems, maintain their vehicle and fleets, and deliver on mobility solutions. Transdev U.S. employs a team of 32,000 across 400 locations while maintaining more than 17,000 vehicles. Find out more at www.TransdevNA.com or watch an overview video at https://youtu.be/ilO5cv0G4mQ

Position Overview

The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing, compiling, and preparing billable transit data for client invoicing. This role requires exceptional analytical skills, proficiency in Excel, and the ability to work closely with both the general manager and client representatives. We offer a comprehensive benefits package and a competitive salary range. This is an office-based position with occasional travel and standard business hours with the potential for overtime during peak billing periods.

Key Responsibilities


 * Collect and compile detailed transit shuttle operation data from multiple sources
 * Perform comprehensive data verification and validation to ensure accuracy of billable hours and services
 * Create detailed Excel spreadsheets documenting shuttle routes, passenger counts, mileage, and billable services
 * Generate monthly billing reports with precise calculations and clear presentations
 * Reconcile discrepancies in transit data and maintain meticulous records
 * Collaborate with the general manager to develop insights and improve data collection processes
 * Prepare executive summaries and presentations of analytical findings
 * Ensure compliance with client billing requirements and internal reporting standards
   
   

Required Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree in business (Preferred) and or 2 years Transportation related experience Statistics, Data Analytics, or related field
 * Experience in data analysis, preferably in transportation or service industries
 * Advanced Excel skills, including pivot tables, complex formulas, and data modeling
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
 * Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
 * Proficiency in data visualization and reporting tools
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Experience with SQL databases
 * Knowledge of transportation management software
 * Familiarity with BI tools like Tableau or Power BI
 * Understanding of transportation billing and invoicing processes
 * Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel
 * Basic understanding of data cleaning and transformation techniques
 * Ability to work with large datasets and perform complex calculations

title: Data Analyst

description:
DataAnnotation is committed to creating quality AI. Join our team to help train AI chatbots while gaining the flexibility of remote work and choosing your own schedule.




We are looking for a proficient Data Analyst to join our team to train our AI chatbots. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.




To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.




Benefits:




 * This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
 * You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
 * You can work on your own schedule
 * Projects are paid hourly, starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses for high-quality and high-volume work




Responsibilities:




 * Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
 * Write high-quality answers and code snippets
 * Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance




Qualifications:




 * Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
 * Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
 * Excellent writing and grammar skills
 * A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)
 * Previous experience as a Software Developer, Coder, Software Engineer, or Programmer




Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD. This job is only available to those in the US, UK, Canada, Australia, or New Zealand. Those located outside of these countries will not see work or assessments available on our site at this time.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Open to remote work except in South Dakota, Vermont and West Virginia.



The annual base salary for this position ranges from $99,500.00 in our lowest geographic market to $222,900.00 in our highest geographic market. Actual salary will vary based on a candidate's location, qualifications, skills and experience.



Information About Benefits Can Be Found Here.



Who We Are Looking For



We are looking for an innovative and experienced expert in the strategy, translation and application of consumer analytics to join our team. You’ll be tasked with identifying opportunities to use consumer knowledge to influence decision-making and to translate analytics and insights into action for our Converse Direct teams.



Key Responsibilities





 * Develop new modeling methodologies and perform analytical reviews to assess model performance and determine new marketing attribution solutions
 * Drive improvement for more efficient features, processes, tools and resources across teams that makes interpretation of data more efficient, accessible, and discoverable
 * Building new reports in Tableau to automate data collection
 * Develop and implement models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to solve complex business problems
 * Lead the data-driven decision-making process, from data collection and analysis to implementation and monitoring of solutions
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business challenges and objectives, translating complex data into actionable insights
 * Stay informed of industry trends and advancements in data science and machine learning, continuously improving our methodologies and technologies
   
   



Education & Experience





 * Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Statistics, Decision Science, Applied Math, Economics, Behavioral Science or other quantitative discipline. Advanced degree in Data Science or Analytics is strongly preferred
 * 5+ years working in applied data or quantitative digital research setting with a track record of delivering insights and business impact preferred
 * A background in the production of consumer data, testing, or customer research in e-commerce, retail, or digital products for targeted communications and consumer journeys
   
   



Qualifications





 * Experience with advanced analytic techniques, such as marketing mix, predictive modeling, multivariate regression analysis and ROI measurement
 * Experience solving complex analytical problems with deep customer focus, applying advanced analytical methods as needed, including big data analysis using SQL, R, Python and other software applications
 * Expertise using data visualization tools such as Tableau
 * Experience with large datasets and relational databases
 * Experience with Snowflake
 * Experience with Databricks is a plus
 * Ability to manage a portfolio of large data projects with multiple business stakeholders in a fast-moving, matrixed setting
 * Track record of being resourceful, identifying creative solutions and discovering new data sets/methodologies to answer business questions a plus
 * Demonstrated experience working successfully in cross-functional teams with varied levels of understanding of data
   
   



We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees and job applicants. We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.
title: Global Consumer & Marketing Analyst - Data Analytics (remote option)

description:
This is a Hybrid Position in Washington, DC/Alexandria, VA, Hyattsville, MD and Need candidates who are local to those Locals as In-Person Interview required.




 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.
 * 5+ experience in data migration projects, specifically from PeopleSoft to a Cloud Based Data Warehouse system.
 * Strong proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation
 * 8+ Experience with ETL tools and data integration techniques.
 * Experience with databases such as ORACLE, SQL Server, SYBASE, INFORMIX, and DB2
 * Familiarity with data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and reporting tools.
 * Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
 * Analyze the existing data structures in PeopleSoft and confirm the necessary transformations for Data Warehouse compatibility.
 * Extract data from PeopleSoft using SQL and other relevant tools.
 * Creation of efficient data structures that support reporting and analytics (expertise in dimensional modeling and entity-relationship (ER) modeling)
 * Develop and implement data transformation processes to clean, standardize, and enhance the quality of the data during migration.
 * Create data mapping documents that outline the relationships between source and target data fields.
 * Design and implement ETL processes to load data into the Data Warehouse, ensuring efficient performance and data integrity.
 * Utilize ETL tools for data integration.
 * Validate data accuracy and completeness post-migration to ensure that all data has been successfully transferred.
 * Work closely with business analysts, data architects, and stakeholders to understand data requirements and ensure alignment with business objectives.
 * Familiarity with data governance, compliance, and data security protocols, including encryption, data masking, and compliance with regulations (e.g., PII, HIPAA)
 * Recommending and analyzing the possibility of Cloud Data Warehousing
title: Business Intelligence Analyst

description:
Job Summary

Responsible for the performance of the overall quality speech analytics category design. Works cross-functionally with various groups internally and externally. Collaborates and synthesizes analyses for the execution of scorecards. Responsible for extrapolating data, developing queries, ensuring standardization of external files, leading projects that relate directly to the speech analytic platform, and make recommendations for the betterment of the company. Works hand-in-hand with other analysts and specialists within the team to build and invent an outstanding product with a prime focus on accuracy, understandability and performance of the product.

Job Responsibilities


 * Implement statistical language models, computational frameworks to process massive volumes of data, and engineer prototypes in a programming language (examples: Python, Java, R).
 * Analytical and knowledgeable, recognize pertinent language patterns and conversational content that lead to business value
 * Analyze recorded audio and audio-based data sets for critical insights.
 * Captures combinations of keywords & phrases within the system for optimal configurations performance
 * Natural Language Processing: Develop and/or apply statistical modeling techniques, optimization methods, and other ML techniques to different applications.
 * Participate in design, development, evaluation, deployment and updating of data-driven models and analytical solutions for natural language applications.
 * Responsible for determining opportunities through analysis of current or future trends and provide ongoing speech category design
 * Determine what call events (keywords and phrases) to train the software to recognize as structured data to support analytics and business goals, by using an inquisitive and intuitive approach
 * Weekly/monthly reporting to management and business units
 * Familiarity with Voice User Interface (VUI) documents
 * Use a variety of testing methods to measure the impact of ongoing campaigns and new initiatives.
 * Build positive relationships, drive decisions and communicate findings to executives and partners.
   
   

An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans

About Walgreens And WBA

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. title: Data Analyst - Remote

description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Eglin AFB, FL

Canvas Inc. is seeking a Data Analyst supporting the 40 FLTS at Eglin AFB, FL. Canvas provides engineering services and technical solutions for customers in federal and commercial markets. We are recognized by our customers and industry partners for our ethical standards, world-class technical expertise, and dedication to accomplish the mission in a responsive, efficient, and affordable manner.

Duties


 * Develops, conducts, and coordinates high-priority planning and in-depth data analyses of major project assignments Assess priority of IPT activities and development projects to optimize tasks and workload
 * Develops analytical tools (mathematical models, equations, computer programs, and computer simulations) to model and analyze data
 * Serves as a consultant on weapon system effectiveness, performance, and analysis to support the development of new armament, sensor, and aircraft systems
 * Supports integrated flight testing of fighter aircraft (currently A-10, F-16 and/or F-15, on projects such as weapon system integration, aircraft software and hardware upgrades, targeting pods, and other similar systems
 * Assists in test planning and design process by identifying test data requirements while working with instrumentation engineers to establish how to collect required data to ensure integrity, assists in collecting and/or downloading data, and reducing data in preparation for analysis
 * Participates in development and reviews of test run cards, program technical reviews, and attends mission briefs and debriefs
 * Assists in obtaining and delivering data to appropriate agencies, participates in review of flight test data and videos, accomplishes data validation/verification to ensure data integrity and accuracy, identifies and/or coordinates flight test data analysis required for isolating test anomalies, and reviews flight test reports for anomaly investigation, technical solution development and coordination
 * Analyzes, identifies, and evaluates issues and coordinates recommendations to resolve substantive and critical problems and issues
 * Assists in database management of test points, watch items, monitors similar test activities conducted by other agencies, and identifies opportunities to conduct integrated test activities
 * May provide oversight on high-visibility or mission critical aspects of a given program. May oversee the efforts of other staff and/or be responsible for the efforts of all staff assigned to a specific job/task.
 * Must be able to effectively communicate orally and possess technical writing skills and work effectively as part of a test team
   
   

Requirements


 * Master's degree in a relevant discipline and 10 years of experience
   
   

BA degree and 8 years of experience may be substituted

Desired


 * Knowledge of Eglin-based flight test processes and procedures, Developmental Test and Evaluation
 * Experience working with Operational or Developmental Test organizations is highly desired
 * Experience with advanced data analysis tools and programs
 * Experience with 4th or 5th Generation aircraft and weapons systems
 * Experience with autonomous aircraft
   
   

Security Clearance


 * Ability to obtain and maintain Secret clearance
   
   

About Us

Founded in 2007, Canvas connects a passion for going beyond the expected with the knowledge and expertise to deliver what our clients need now and in the future. Canvas has been recognized as a Great Place to Work Certified ™, Fortune Best Small Workplace ™, Fortune Best Workplace for Millennials ™ (2022), Best Place for Working Parents (2022 & 2023), HIRE Vets Gold Medallion Awardee (2021 & 2022), Best Places to Work Awardee, 2019 Government Contracting - Technology Business of the Year, and Woman-Owned Small Business of the Year (2018) by the Huntsville/Madison Chamber of Commerce.

Benefits Of Working With Canvas

To reflect our company culture, Canvas offers an exciting array of benefits that makes up our employees' total rewards package. Those benefits may include:


 * Competitive Wages*
 * Medical, Rx, Dental & Vision Insurance
 * Generous company-funded Basic Life Insurance
 * Company-funded Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
 * 11 Paid Federal Holidays
 * Generous Paid Time Off (PTO)
 * Dependent Care and Medical Flexible Spending Accounts
 * 401(k) retirement plan with company match and 100% immediate vesting
 * Tuition Reimbursement for ongoing training, continuing education, or advanced degree programs
 * Robust Employee Assistance Program
 * Employee Referral Bonus Program
 * Corporate Sponsored Events & Community Outreach
 * Spot Awards for exemplary individual performance
 * Discretionary performance-based bonuses
 * And many more!
 * Final compensation for this position is determined by a variety of factors, such as a candidate's relevant work experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location.
   
   

Canvas is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Canvas is an equal opportunity employer and a VEVRAA federal contractor who affords equal employment opportunity to protected veterans and people with disabilities.

Canvas has equal employment opportunities that are based upon a candidate's qualifications and capabilities to perform the essential functions of a particular job and are free from discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit our Careers page. U.S. citizenship is required for most positions.

Canvas is committed to expanding access to employment for people with disabilities and disabled veterans. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, and your disability prevents you from applying, please advise what reasonable accommodation Canvas can provide to assist you in applying for one of our open positions. You may contact us by sending an email to talent@canvas-inc.com.

Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation for applying for a specific posted position will be responded to. Requests will be kept confidential and shared strictly on a need-to-know basis. Please be aware, scammers may try to impersonate our company by reaching out regarding job opportunities. We will never ask you for bank account information, checks, or other sensitive information as part of our hiring process. If you're unsure, please email talent@canvas-inc.com with questions.

For further information on Canvas including more information on employee benefits and our company culture, visit our website.

If an offer of employment is extended, applicant must have the ability to pass a background check. Offer of Employment is contingent upon the results.
