title: Data Analyst

description:
Job Summary

This role supports the enterprise's data governance program. Responsibilities include evaluating data sets and applications to classify data (e.g., PHI, PII, Business Sensitive) and analyzing governance issues to identify problems, opportunities, and solutions. The position will represent Data Governance in support of projects, through collaboration with internal stakeholders, third-party vendors, and clients. Additionally, the role includes developing and managing policies, processes, and standards, as well as facilitating communication with business partners, technology and the Data Governance team members.

Job Responsibility


 * Utilizes information management tools as well as various data sources, to uncover and determine root causes of data governance issues.
 * Works closely with internal business users and clients (data owners) to resolve data governance issues.
 * Takes a hands on approach to data governance. Create a baseline for use in periodic data governance reviews and audits.
 * Defines the degree of data governance required for all data elements and the values required for each element to support data usage.
 * Collaborates with data architects to incorporate data governance screening/tests for data elements into data sourcing processes (ETL).
 * Articulates the need for and benefits of data governance to vendors, clients groups, system users, and other stakeholders.
 * Identifies and leverages opportunities to continually improve the governance of data management systems, processes, policies, and standards.
 * Engages and partners with 3rd party vendors, internal development, and other parties as needed. Establishes data governance metrics and provides reports on metrics attainment.
   
   

“About Walgreens and WBA

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide.”

The actual salary an employee can expect to receive, plus bonus pursuant to the terms of any bonus plan if applicable, will depend on experience, seniority, geographic location, and other factors permitted by law. To review benefits, please visit jobs.walgreens.com/benefits.

"An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans".

Basic Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree and at least 2 years of experience as a business analyst on information management projects (e.g., data governance, data warehousing/business intelligence, meta data management, master data management).
 * Knowledge of information management tools such as data cleansing, data profiling, meta data management, master data/CDI, data modeling, business intelligence
 * Experience with analyzing and resolving data issues, trends, or exceptions including data conformity, data governance, or data sensitivity aspects.
 * Experience developing ways of accomplishing goals with little or no supervision, depending on oneself to complete objectives and determining when escalation of issues is necessary.
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree in MIS, CS, IM
 * Experience in retail or healthcare industries
 * High level of knowledge of data governance related laws and regulations, specifically State Privacy Laws and HIPPA
   
   

We will consider employment of qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
title: Analyst, Data Governance

description:
If you’re looking for a high-energy, inclusive atmosphere and a company that understands the importance of work/life balance, Commonwealth is your match! From generous bonus and 401(k) programs to tuition reimbursement and flexible work schedules, Commonwealth is focused on helping its employees thrive in an environment suited to their needs. On top of all that, the Data & Analytics department offers a hybrid work schedule, so you’ll be able to work from home for part of the week!

We’re looking for a business data analyst to join our ranks. The business data analyst will be responsible for fulfilling SQL data requests for the business and utilize the knowledge gained to identify business requirements for the future self-service environment.

Key Responsibilities


 * Writing SQL queries and integrates data from multiple data sources or functional areas, ensures data accuracy and integrity
 * Evaluating user requests and directs them to COE self-service reports when applicable, walking the user through the steps to get to the data they need
 * Working collaboratively with business users, the Data & Analytics team, and IT to understand data needs, data governance decisions, identify requirements for buildout of self-service reporting environment
 * Analyzing report requests to identify legacy location of source data, maps source to target, documents additional logic to prepare technical requirements
 * Validating data elements loaded into enterprise data warehouse
 * Submitting business data requests to vendor’s data team on behalf of the business users as needed and monitor to fulfillment
   
   
   

Core Strengths And Skills


 * Proficiency in SQL
 * Bachelor’s degree in a Finance or Information Systems-related field
 * Financial Services experience a plus
 * Familiarity with data models, databases, data warehouses, and data querying
 * Ability to communicate business and technical information to people of various backgrounds
 * Strong interpersonal and communication skills
 * Great analytical and problem-solving skills
 * Strong initiative, work ethic, ambition to drive for results, and ability to operate with ambiguity
   
   
   

Have we piqued your curiosity? Can you see yourself thriving in this opportunity?

Picture Yourself Here

At Commonwealth, we believe in a better world. We hold ourselves and each other to higher standards. We take care of one another. That’s why we invest in you—we encourage employee growth both in your career and education; we are building out a robust diversity, equity, and inclusion program; we offer incredible health care benefits; and we find plenty of occasions to celebrate. What’s not to love?

We are always striving to be better, and we are looking for employees who share that same mindset. Better people, better coworkers, better leaders, better creators. Bring your best work and your full self to the table, and we will do the same. Together, we can build a better future for our advisors, their clients, our company, and you.

About Commonwealth

Commonwealth Financial Network, Member FINRA/SIPC, a Registered Investment Adviser, provides a suite of business solutions that empowers more than 2,000 independent financial advisors nationwide. Privately held since 1979, the firm has headquarters in Waltham, Massachusetts; San Diego, California and a new office opening soon in greater Cincinnati, Ohio.

Turning our advisors into raving fans starts by doing the same for our employees. We foster an environment of excellence, growth, rewards, and fun in equal measure, which has earned us 44 Best Place to Work awards.

The Fine Print

We care about your online safety as a prospective employee and encourage you to exercise caution when responding to job postings online. Commonwealth will never ask potential hiring candidates to pay or transfer funds as a precondition of interviews or employment, nor will we authorize recruiters or agents to do so on our behalf.

Commonwealth is an equal opportunity employer, making intentional efforts to source talent from all backgrounds.

Min

USD $82,800.00/Yr.

Max

USD $99,300.00/Yr.

description:
Brief Description

Senior Data Analyst (Finance) – ABA Centers of America

Fort Lauderdale, Florida

About ABA Centers Of America

ABA Centers of America is a healthcare innovator experiencing steady growth while revolutionizing the autism care field. We provide ABA (Applied Behavior Analysis) therapy and diagnostic services to our clients and families in our centers, in homes, and in the community.

Listed by Inc. magazine as the 5th fastest-growing private company in the U.S., we are focused on opening new clinics and remaining self-funded without private equity investment. Committed to our sustainability and philosophy of innovation, our Chairman and Founder received the country’s preeminent business award, Ernst and Young’s Entrepreneur Of The Year® 2024 National Overall Award.

We are currently in 10 states with over 30 clinical service areas, and our roadmap will bring us to more than 50 clinical service areas over the next 12-24 months. We have the resources and talent usually found at a more mature organization, including fully staffed teams to support marketing, IT, accounting, and clinic growth.

Growth Opportunity

Do you look forward to unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Can you dig into data-rich environments and produce objective information that can lead to informed decisions?

We need an experienced data analyst to join our fast-growing company and marshal our resources to develop an innovative financial data analysis program.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines and infrastructure to support the extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of insurance claims data. This role will ensure data is accessible, reliable, and ready for analysis to generate reports, KPIs, and financial insights.

What You'll Do


 * Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes to handle large volumes of insurance claims data.
 * Collaborate with financial analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and ensure data availability.
 * Optimize data extraction and transformation processes for performance and efficiency.
 * Implement data quality checks and validation procedures to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
 * Develop and maintain data models and databases.
 * Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline issues and implement solutions to prevent future occurrences.
 * Leverage raw and multi-sourced data sets and design, build, and deliver datasets that unlock insightful information for teams across the company.
 * Support ad-hoc reporting based on data provided to the Finance team.
 * Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and technologies in data engineering and healthcare data management.
   
   
   

Requirements

Education/Experience and Other Requirements


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related field.
 * Proven experience as a Senior Data Analyst, preferably in the healthcare industry.
 * Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with database management systems (e.g., Snowflake).
 * Experience with ETL tools and frameworks.
 * Familiarity with big data technologies and cloud platforms.
 * Proficiency in using Tableau, Power BI, Excel, and other relevant tools to analyze complex datasets, derive meaningful insights, and build interactive dashboards that visualize key performance indicators (KPIs).
 * Knowledge of healthcare data standards and protocols is a plus.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
 * Strong communication and collaboration skills.
   
   
   

Summary

Benefits


 * 21 paid days off (15 days of PTO, which increases with tenure, plus 6 holidays)
 * Medical, dental, vision, long-term disability, and life insurance.
 * Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) options.
 * Generous 401(k) with employer match up to 6%.
   
   
   

ABA Centers of America Culture

ABA Centers of America is an environment propelled by collaboration through our team-member philosophy: “Empowering Your Ambition.” That means we want to do everything we can to help team members fulfill their professional goals.

Most importantly, ABA Centers of America team members understand that clients come first and are at the center of everything we do.

ABA Centers of America participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Kaseya® is the leading provider of complete IT infrastructure and security management solutions for Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and internal IT organizations worldwide powered by AI. Kaseya’s best-in-breed technologies allow organizations to efficiently manage and secure IT to drive sustained business success. Kaseya has achieved sustained, strong double-digit growth over the past several years and is backed by Insight Venture Partners www.insightpartners.com), a leading global private equity firm investing in high-growth technology and software companies that drive transformative change in the industries they serve.

Founded in 2000, Kaseya currently serves customers in over 20 countries across a wide variety of industries and manages over 15 million endpoints worldwide. To learn more about our company and our award-winning solutions, go to www.Kaseya.com and for more information on Kaseya’s culture, please click here: Kaseya Culture.

Kaseya is not your typical company. We are not afraid to tell you exactly who we are and our expectations. We have achieved record levels of success being BOLD, being GRITTY, being ACCOUNTABLE. The thousands of people that succeed at Kaseya are prepared to go above and beyond for the betterment of our customers, and the betterment of their careers and long-term financial wealth.

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Product Data Analyst to join our Product Operations team. You will be responsible for analyzing product data, generating insights, and helping to define KPIs that guide product management decisions. This role is a critical link between data-driven insights and the product team, ensuring product strategies are backed by robust data.

Essential Responsibilities


 * Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze product performance, user behavior, and feature adoption metrics to provide actionable insights to the product team.
 * KPIs & Metrics: Work closely with Product Managers and Product Operations to define, track, and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) across the product portfolio.
 * Dashboards & Reporting: Build and maintain dashboards that provide real-time insights into product performance, customer engagement, and operational efficiencies.
 * Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with Product Managers, Engineering, Customer Support, Sales, and Marketing teams to ensure successful product delivery and adoption.
 * Data Integrity: Ensure data accuracy and consistency across various platforms and tools, identifying gaps or areas of improvement in data collection methods.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
 * 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or product management roles.
 * Proficiency with data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, Power BI, or similar.
 * Ability to translate complex data sets into clear and actionable insights.
 * Excellent communication skills to present data and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 * Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
   
   

WHY JOIN US


 * Be part of a growing Product Operations team that directly impacts product strategy.
 * Work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with opportunities for professional growth.
   
   

Join the Kaseya growth rocket ship and see how we are #ChangingLives !

Additional Information

Kaseya provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, age, ancestry, gender, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Data Analyst Intern

description:
We are as invested in your career as you are.

As you navigate through these uncertain times, know that Pinkerton has been a stable, thriving corporation for over 170 years. As recognized leaders around the globe in the corporate risk management industry, you can rest assured that joining us now means moving to a future-looking company. We are here today, will be here tomorrow, and are a thriving community of over 2,000 risk management professionals.

This is just one of the several exciting career opportunities that are currently available.

Job Summary

TheÿIntelligence Analyst, assigned to one of Pinkerton's largest global clients,ÿwill be responsible for executing global intelligence analysis services in support of the Global Security Intelligence program. The Analyst performs day-to-day monitoring, conducts trend identification and analysis, and facilitates deeper research and assessment of key topics or issues relevant to Global Security needs.

Essential Functions


 * Represent Pinkerton's core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
 * Manage the collection of intelligence information used to populate various standard reports and updates.
 * Monitor press, intelligence subscriptions, social media posts, and other online sources daily.
 * Monitor, track, and communicate impact to the customer.
 * Continuously monitor and refine OSINT tools, subscriptions, and queries.
 * Collaborate with key stakeholders and partners across multiple lines of business.
 * Effectively work as part of an interdisciplinary, global team managing multipleÿtasks and projects with minimal supervision.
 * Develop and/or improve standard operating procedures and program documents.
 * Establish and maintain systematic cross referenced intelligence records and files.
 * Articulate key findings extrapolated from sourced data with a focus on the assigned region which includes providing written assessments, formal report writing, and verbal briefings to Regional and Global Security customers.ÿ
 * Receive and process incoming report requests and messages.
 * Initiate, execute, and maintain intelligence relationships inside and outside the organization.
 * Safeguard and maintain highly sensitive and confidential information.
 * All other duties, as assigned.
   
   

Education, Experience, And Certifications

Bachelor's degree with three to five years of work experience in government and/or corporate intelligence, or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company. Pinkerton is an inclusive employer who seeks candidates with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.

Competencies


 * Foreign language skills, preferred.
 * Knowledge and experience of OSINT tools and strategies.
 * Foundational knowledge in structured intelligence analysis.
 * Sound analytical judgement and ability to identify how geopolitics and international security concerns impact multinational corporations.
 * Extensive experience writing intelligence reports for various stakeholders.
 * Effective written and verbal communication skills in English.
 * Able to complete assignments independently at proscribed deadlines.
 * Able to build good relationships internally/externally and establish credibility quickly.
 * Time management skills.
 * Able to work independently with minimal supervision and under adverse and stressful conditions.
 * Able to handle highly confidential and sensitive information with discretion and diplomacy.
 * Computer skills; Microsoft Office & Power Platforms.
   
   

Working Conditions

With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to effectively perform all essential functions;


 * Regular computer usage.
 * Occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment.
 * Frequent sitting.
 * Able to be flex work schedule to accommodate emergencies.
 * Travel, as required.
   
   

Salary & Benefits Information

Rate of pay: $95,000 / year.

Benefit options include employer-paid life and AD&D, voluntary life and AD&D, medical, (HSA) Health Savings Account, (FSA) Flexible Savings Account, dental, vision, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(K), paid time off (vacation, personal, sick, and holidays) and several employee assistance-related programs. This information provides a brief benefit overview. Upon the acceptance of an employment offer, the new employee will receive comprehensive plan details based on specific eligibility rules.

Pinkerton is an equal opportunity employer to all applicants and positions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital/prenatal status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, religion, creed, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any protected status by local, state, federal or country-specific law.
title: Intelligence Analyst (Remote)

description:
Job Description

This Opportunity

WSP USA hosts hundreds of internships across the United States to gain hands-on, meaningful work experience to enhance their education and professional aptitude. Our interns gain exposure to real projects while working side by side with senior staff. Through our Developing Professionals Network, interns gain mentorship, networking opportunities and lifelong career connections.

Our PHL IT Network Program team is seeking a part-time Data Science Analyst with a computer science degree to work out of the New York One Penn Plaza office. This temporary position is seeking individuals currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program.

This internship is anticipated to take place during the Spring 2025 semester. This position is designed to give the candidate exposure to a wide array of client projects and WSP-internal initiatives in our Transportation and Infrastructure (T&I) business. Once onboarded, the candidate will be assigned to the PHL IT NET Program’s Fiber Audit Project, focusing on the netTerrain data management-related tasks.

Your Impact


 * Support a variety of data analyst-related tasks including mathematical data science, database systems, statistics, and statistical analysis methods with the goal to develop technical, social, and ethical skills.
 * Learn basic principles of business intelligence and operational systems.
 * Complete training on assigned tasks.
 * Assist with the management and optimization of the netTerrain tool for fiber audit processes.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure accurate data collection and reporting.
 * Analyze data and generate reports to assist technical leads in informing project decisions.
 * Learn compliance with industry standards and best practices to better support the project.
 * Assist and work with vendors in troubleshooting technical issues related to the netTerrain tool.
 * Assist with the maintenance of documentation related to the fiber audit process and tool usage.
 * Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources, and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.
 * Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.
 * Please note that there is no relocation or housing assistance associated with this internship.
   
   
   

Who You Are

Required Qualifications


 * Actively enrolled in an accredited B.S. or M.S. program in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field with an anticipated graduation date of May 2025 or later.
 * Must be 18 or older.
 * Demonstrated interest in mathematical data science, computational theory, programming languages, reinforcement learning, business intelligence, data analysis tools and techniques, artificial intelligence, or a related field, and a strong desire to advance skills related to WSP’s work and projects.
 * Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to both engineering and non-engineering audiences.
 * Capable of taking direction from leadership, mentors, and managers to execute projects.
 * Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.
 * Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and the ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety, drug/alcohol, and harassment policies.
 * Authorization to work in the United States at the start of the internship.
   
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Actively enrolled in an accredited Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related Master’s program with an anticipated graduation date of May 2025 or later.
 * Experienced with technical writing and MS Office software.
 * Possesses prior internship experience and leadership involvement on campus.
   
   
   

Compensation:

Expected Salary (all locations): $19.10 - $30.00

WSP USA is providing the compensation range that the company in good faith believes it might pay and offer for this position, based on the successful applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities in addition to internal equity and specific geographic location. WSP USA reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, and/or federal law.

About WSP

ABOUT US

WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper.

www.wsp.com

WSP provides a flexible and agile workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.

At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?

WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race/Age/Color/Religion/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin/Disability or Protected Veteran Status.

The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.

NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES:

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters, employment agencies, or other staffing services. Unsolicited resumes include any resume or hiring document sent to WSP in the absence of a signed Service Agreement where WSP has expressly requested recruitment/staffing services specific to the position at hand. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers or other business leaders, will become the property of WSP and WSP will have the right to hire that candidate without reservation – no fee or other compensation will be owed or paid to the recruiter, employment agency, or other staffing service.
title: Data Science Analyst- Spring 2025

description:
Clinical Data Analyst

Vancouver, Washington

$80000K-$85000K Range

Why Choose GMR? Global Medical Response (GMR) and its family of solutions are dedicated to delivering compassionate, quality medical care, primarily in the areas of emergency and patient relocation services. Here you’ll embark in meaningful work that will make an impact on you and the customers we service. View our employees’s stories on how we provide care to the world at www.AtaMomentsNotice.com.

With more than 38,000 employees, Global Medical Response teams deliver compassionate, quality medical care, primarily in the areas of emergency and patient relocation services around the world. We provide end-to-end medical transportation as well as fire services, integrated healthcare solutions and disaster response.

Position Summary

The Clinical Data Analyst is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining reporting solutions. This role is instrumental in data collection, dashboard development, reporting and identifying areas for performance improvement. This role will maintain a portfolio of quality and utilization reports to drive improved performance with value-based contracts. Responsibilities include sharing actionable performance dashboards with value-based care leadership, operational leadership and quality improvement teams. Other duties include assisting with analysis of clinical quality metrics, operational trends, compliance reporting, and utilization in support of value-based care strategies.

Duties & Responsibilities


 * Analyze current data to perform gap analysis on report available and utility of current reports.
 * Query, review and gather data from multiple internal/external sources to create dashboards, drill down capable reports and key performance indicators.
 * Provide analytical expertise in data quality, improvement opportunities and understanding of variation in the clinical and quality metrics.
 * Utilize Tableau, Power BI, ESO, and other data visualization software to create actionable dashboards and reports.
 * Provide consultative support for value-based care leaders on improvement opportunities for clinical and quality metrics.
 * Facilitate the efficient use of dashboards, reports and presentations for clinic-based improvement projects.
 * Analyze and vet report as well as help colleagues interpret the information to answer clinical and quality performance questions.
 * Works in conjunction with the Director of Operations, Clark County Medical Program Director, Clinical QA/QI Coordinator.
 * Reviews project requests describing clinical database user needs.
 * Attends specification meetings with Clinical and Educational Services (CES) team members to determine scope and limitations of projects.
 * Works closely with front-end users to ensure program usability, recognize data collection issues, and recommend solutions.
 * Troubleshoots and improves existing reports and reporting logic to meet clinical data user needs.
 * Develops data models describing data elements and how they are used.
 * Designs, executes, and interprets the results of custom T- SQL queries linking multiple databases.
 * Contributes to planning of system operations. Design data collection instruments for focused investigations and audits.
 * Responds to Value leadership requests for analysis and reporting related to clinical and quality performance.
   
   

Minimum Qualifications


 * High School Diploma or GED.
 * Advanced Excel knowledge & Experience.
 * Experience using SQL and analyzing queries.
 * Experience analyzing, interpreting, summarizing, displaying and presenting data.
 * Using desktop software and data visualization tools.
 * Experience extracting data from EMR, preferably ESO and Epic.
 * Excellent computer skills including Microsoft applications.
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
   
   

Working Conditions And Mental/Physical Requirements


 * Work is generally performed in a typical interior/office environment or remote as determined by the Director of Operation’s discretion.
 * Frequently required to sit for long periods.
 * Work requires stooping, walking, grasping, and repetitive motions; vocal communication is required for expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word; visual acuity is necessary for preparing and analyzing written or computer data, determining the accuracy and thoroughness of work, and observing general surrounds and activities.
 * Pass drug screen, and background check.
 * Continually required to perceive normal speaking levels with or without correction and can receive detailed information through oral communication.
 * Frequently required to stand, walk, and use hands and arms.
 * Must be able to read/comprehend, write, perform calculations, reason, and analyze.
 * Special Requirements - Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential tasks.
 * Critical thinking skills with the ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems.
   
   

To learn more about GMR and how our values are at the core of our services and vital to how we approach care, visit www.GlobalMedicalResponse.com.

EEO Statement

Global Medical Response and its family of companies are an Equal Opportunity Employer, which includes supporting veterans and providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with a disability.


 * Salary Range $120,000K-$125,000K
 * Check out our careers site Benefits | GMR Careers to learn more about our comprehensive benefit options, which include medical, vision, dental, 401k, disability, FSA, HSA, EAP, vacation and paid time off.
 * The application window for this position is anticipated to close on 12.19.2024
title: Data Analyst

description:
As Sr. Data Analyst II, you’ll play a critical role in shaping the Air Force Logistics Enterprise’s data-driven decision-making. You will also be an analytics strategy expert with experience supporting the Air Force Logistics Enterprise in leveraging Envision data systems to inform strategic decisions and guide decision making for complex initiatives spanning the logistics directorate (maintenance, readiness, munitions).


We know that you can’t have great technology services without amazing people. At MetroStar, we are obsessed with our people and have led a two-decade legacy of building the best and brightest teams. Because we know our future relies on our deep understanding and relentless focus on our people, we live by our mission: A passion for our people. Value for our customers.


If you think you can see yourself delivering our mission and pursuing our goals with us, then check out the job description below!


What you’ll do:


   
   
 * Your day will involve a mix of analytical work, strategic collaboration, and executive-level reporting to ensure that key logistics initiatives are supported by timely, accurate data.
   
   


What you’ll need to succeed:


   
   
 * An active U.S. Government issued Secret security clearance.
   
   
 * 8+ years leading and supporting AF Analytics initiatives and facilitation experience at the executive level. 
   
   
 * Extensive knowledge of AF operations (ACTF, FHP, manpower, aircraft operational and performance metrics).
   
   
 * Data Scientist with experience extracting, manipulating, and presenting Air Force logistics and manpower data from multiple sources into oral, written, and graphic depictions for use by senior leadership.
   
   
 * AF KPI development experience: Ready Aircraft Metric (RAM); Days of Health
   
   


Like we said, we are big fans of our people. That’s why we offer a generous benefits package, professional growth, and valuable time to recharge. Learn more about our company culture code and benefits. Plus, check out our accolades.


Don’t meet every single requirement? 


Studies have shown that women, people of color and the LGBTQ+ community are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification.  At MetroStar we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic culture, so, if you’re excited about this role, but your previous experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to go ahead and apply.  We pride ourselves on making great matches, and you may be the perfect match for this role or another one we have. Best of luck! – The MetroStar People & Culture Team


What we want you to know:


In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.


MetroStar Systems is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of MetroStar Systems.


Not ready to apply now?


Sign up to join our newsletter here.

"EEO IS THE LAW MetroStar Systems, LLC (MetroStar) invites any employee and/or applicant to review the Company’s Affirmative Action Plan. This plan is available for inspection upon request by emailing msshr@metrostar.com."
title: Sr. Data Analyst II (5559)

description:
Title: Data Governance Analyst

Location: Mid-Atlantic Region / Remote or Hybrid

Employment Type: Contract

Description


 * The Data Governance Analyst plays a pivotal role in establishing and implementing enterprise-wide data governance practices.
 * This position involves collaboration across departments to gather requirements, define data principles, and ensure data quality.
 * The analyst will evaluate and profile datasets, support the creation of policies and standards, and assist in resolving data anomalies to drive effective data management strategies.
   
   

Responsibilities


 * Collaborate with data governance leads and stewards to develop, coordinate, and promote data principles, policies, and standards.
 * Work as part of a team to gather requirements and assess data governance tools.
 * Analyze datasets to identify quality issues and ensure the accuracy and completeness of data definitions.
 * Use data quality tools to interrogate datasets and design monitors to meet project needs.
 * Perform detailed data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, and summarize findings.
 * Document business rules and perform root cause analysis for data anomalies, working with data stewards to resolve issues.
 * Support the enterprise’s master data management initiatives.
   
   

Required Skills


 * Strong skills in gathering and documenting requirements.
 * Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field, or equivalent experience.
 * Proficiency in analyzing complex databases and understanding relational database modeling concepts.
 * Intermediate proficiency with SQL.
 * Experience translating business requirements into data and analytical needs.
 * At least 4 years of experience in data management, data integration, data governance, or data quality projects.
   
   

Desired Skills


 * Familiarity with programming languages and data visualization tools.
 * Experience in business analysis and data governance roles.
 * Working knowledge of data governance tools and platforms.
 * Knowledge of Agile methodology.
   
   

Compensation

Pay Range: $51.44-$73.49

Benefits

Learn more about our benefits offerings here: https://www.mitchellmartin.com/careers/benefits-perks

EEO Statement

Learn more about our EEO policy here: https://www.mitchellmartin.com/eoe-statement

description:
Reingold is hiring a mid-level professional to help manage and contribute to data projects in the areas of business intelligence and survey research. You will be supporting a portfolio of evaluation projects for health-focused government and nonprofit clients, helping a diverse team build strategies and tools for measuring the success of client programs.

This is a hybrid role, requiring two days on-site at Reingold’s headquarters in Alexandria, Virginia.

Job Duties


 * Help project leaders develop and present strategies to client executives for running successful research and data projects.
 * Provide a business-side perspective when guiding Microsoft Power Platform developers to translate requirements into technical solutions.
 * Analyze and synthesize findings into actionable insights and recommendations, and frequently deliver presentations to both technical and nontechnical audiences.
 * Advise colleagues on best practices in survey design, data reporting, and client engagement.
 * Develop and advise others on surveys, reports, data visualizations, and documentation materials, including the solicitation and incorporation of internal and external feedback.
 * Cultivate trusting relationships with clients, and continually advocate for their strategic goals throughout the project life cycle.
 * Collaborate with colleagues and clients to gather and clarify all business and technical requirements for data collection, analysis, and reporting.
 * Support the team in automating processes to streamline reporting and enhance productivity, using tools such as Microsoft Power Automate.
 * Uphold industry standards for data quality and integrity.
 * Support project leaders with staffing, strategy, and prioritization decisions.
 * Manage and support multiple evaluation projects simultaneously.
   
   

Required Qualifications


 * Bachelor’s degree in business administration, management, or a research-oriented social science.
 * At least five years of experience, including in account management, consulting, or similar customer service roles.
 * Ability to obtain a security clearance.
 * Experience with research methodologies, especially survey design and focus groups.
 * Advanced proficiency in Excel, including nested formulas, pivot tables, and dual-axis graphs.
 * Proficiency in PowerPoint and Word, especially formatting graphs and tables.
 * Experience coordinating teams and reviewing others’ work for accuracy and strength.
 * Critical thinking skills, with a mindset for both the big picture and the small details.
 * Strong organizational skills and a reputation for being detail oriented.
 * Exceptional writing and speaking skills.
 * Innate desire for continual performance improvement.
 * Ability to prioritize and complete work with minimal supervision.
 * Aptitude and passion for learning new technologies.
 * Entrepreneurial spirit and a positive attitude.
   
   

Bonus Points For


 * Exposure to Microsoft Power BI, Apps, Automate, or Pages.
 * Experience working with government clients.
 * Experience with task tracking tools, such as Monday.com, Trello, Jira, or Asana.
 * Credentials or coursework related to project management (e.g., PMP).
 * An interest in education, health care, or military or veteran communities.
   
   

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship now or in the future. Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.

title: Staff Data Analyst

description:
Why you'll LOVE Sagent:

You could work anywhere. We know you are talented and looking for something inspiring and impactful. A place where you will make a difference and have a great time doing it!

By choosing Sagent, you can be part of our mission to make loans and homeownership simpler and safer for all consumers.

Sagent powers servicers and consumers. You power Sagent!

About the Opportunity:

We are a leading mortgage servicing, SaaS-based, financial technology company committed to innovation and excellence.

We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced individual to join our dynamic Technology department as a Data Services Analyst at the Specialist level.

This role offers an exciting opportunity for candidates with a strong background in data analysis and database management to contribute to critical projects that drive the company's success.

Your day-to-day at Sagent:

Data Analysis:


 * Develop and conduct data analysis to support evaluation, research, assessment, strategic planning, and management decisions.
 * Apply a theoretical knowledge base to achieve goals through individual work.
   
   

Database Design and Implementation:


 * Analyze, design, create, and implement databases, including data models, logical and physical databases, data dictionaries and schemas, access methods, device allocations, validation checks, organization, and security.
 * Develop and implement database recovery plans and procedures.
   
   

Policy and Procedure Development:


 * Develop and implement database analysis and development policies, standards, and procedures.
 * Provide guidance to others as an individual contributor, project manager, or lead using technical expertise.
   
   

Collaboration and Vendor Interaction:


 * Collaborate with database software vendors and external technical support on issues such as software upgrades, problems, and potential solutions.
 * Engage in effective communication with external partners and vendors to ensure seamless database operations.
   
   

We would love to hear from you if you have:


 * Two years of college in a relevant discipline +4 years of experience in a related field OR Four-year college degree completed in a relevant discipline +2 years of experience in a related field OR Completion of an advanced degree (masters or higher) in an applicable and relevant field or experience will be considered in lieu of a degree.
 * Proven expertise in data analysis and database management.
 * Strong theoretical knowledge applied to achieve goals through individual work.
 * Specific functional expertise gained through formal education and experience.
 * Ability to provide guidance to others in project management or technical expertise.
 * Proficiency in developing and implementing databases, data models, and recovery plans.
 * Knowledge of database analysis and development policies, standards, and procedures.
 * Effective collaboration with database software vendors and external technical support.
 * 1+ years of experience as a data analyst, developer, data warehouse consumer and / or data related operations
 * 1+ Years of working experience or exposure to GCP or any other Cloud development and deployment practices.
 * Hands-On, working knowledge of .Net, Java and SQL language, (i.e. T-SQL (Microsoft)
 * Mid-level to expert knowledge in data integration concepts, source-to-target mapping techniques and requirements documentation for ETL team to follow
 * Experience in interviewing business partners, setting and managing expectations in relation to deliverables and requirements
 * Understanding of Agile development methodologies and software project life cycle and associated methodologies.
 * Experience with standard systems analysis tools and procedures
 * Ability to prioritize and handle multiple projects.
 * Excellent problem solving, analytical, and customer service skills.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to establish deep understanding of clients business issues.
   
   

Preferred


 * Any experience in Mortgage and/or financial industry is strongly preferred
 * Working knowledge of Big Data concepts in organizing both structured and unstructured data is a big plus
   
   

Perks!

As a Sagent Associate, you will be eligible to participate in our benefit programs beginning on Day #1! We offer a comprehensive package including Remote/Hybrid workplace options, Health Benefits, Unlimited Flexible Time Off, Family Planning Services, Tuition Reimbursement, Paid Family Leave, 401(k) Matching, Pet Insurance, LinkedIn Learning, Virtual Social Experiences, Career Pathing, Focus Time Fridays and much, much more!

Why Sagent?

Sagent is transforming the mortgage servicing industry by bringing the modern experience customers now expect from loan originations to loan servicing. Our platform lets customers manage their home-owing lives from anywhere while giving servicers lower costs, scale compliance and higher servicing values through full market cycles.

Sagent is a joint venture that combines Fiserv Inc.'s decades of market-leading fintech expertise with Warburg Pincus' skill in growing technology companies. We hire innovators and doers to disrupt the last and most complex frontier of lending and housing. We're growing fast and need you to help shape our future.

Sagent is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

description:
The Business Intelligence Analyst supports the analysis of operational workflows and lifetime profitability to measure operational and marketing channel effectiveness, and ensure adequate profitability for the business being written by the Direct Group. The person is responsible for assisting in the creation and maintenance of various databases, performance metrics and analytics required to achieve these goals.



Essential Functions and Responsibilities

 * Works closely with others to gain strong understanding of insurance concepts such as financial P&Ls, expense ratios, rate level indications, loss ratio trends, and marketing funnel metrics and to get familiar with internal workflows (i.e. underwriting, sales and claims handling).
 * Identify creative reporting solutions, including ad-hoc analysis that facilitates effective measurement of operational effectiveness. Upgrade existing reports to increase efficiency of distribution, reduce redundancy across reports and to improve ease of presentation.
 * Collaborate with other analytical teams throughout the enterprise to review insights from recent analytical exercises.
 * Effectively uses available front end reporting tools, data systems and information gathered from different areas throughout the company to analyze business issues. Communicate results to management.
 * Work with large databases from Production Data warehouse. Collaborate with data teams to leverage tools and techniques developed for effective data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL).
 * Build automated reporting and analytical tools, which includes a) queries that extract and summarize data from our data warehouse and b) procedures that integrate this data into dynamic workbooks allowing for multiple levels of analysis.
 * Acts as a liaison between the Business Intelligence team and other departments within the Direct Group.



Qualifications and Education

 * Demonstrated problem solving experience gained through related coursework and work experience. BA/BS degree in quantitative field of study.
 * Property and Casualty Insurance experience preferred.
 * Analytical problem solver with a high level of intellectual curiosity and attention to detail. Prior Product or Actuarial experience desired.
 * Strong programming/query experience in SQL Server and Tableau report building.
 * Proficient with all Microsoft Office products.
 * Three or more years of experience with relational database tools and concepts.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 * Collaborative nature, but also has the ability to work independently and efficiently on a high volume of tasks.

About the Company

The Plymouth Rock Company and its affiliated group of companies write and manage over $2 billion in personal and commercial auto and homeowner’s insurance throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic, where we have built an unparalleled reputation for service. We continuously invest in technology, our employees thrive in our empowering environment, and our customers are among the most loyal in the industry. The Plymouth Rock group of companies employs more than 1,900 people and is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts. Plymouth Rock Assurance Corporation holds an A.M. Best rating of “A-/Excellent”.

title: Analyst (Data Coordinator)

description:
Your Title: Data Analyst

Job Location: Hybrid-Dayton, OH or Westminster, CO or US Remote

Our Department: Global Services (GS)

Are you ready to take on a key role where you turn complex data into clear, impactful insights that inspire data-driven decision-making and empower stakeholders at every level of the organization

What You Will Do

In this role, you will be at the forefront of driving data-driven decision-making by mining, cleaning, analyzing, interpreting, and communicating insights to Global Services stakeholders. Your work will empower business leaders to turn data into actionable strategies that achieve impactful results. While your primary focus will be on analyzing data for the Trimble Protected protection plan business, you'll also contribute to data analysis and reporting across other areas within Global Services. You'll deliver insights both regularly and on an ad hoc basis, becoming a trusted partner in helping stakeholders make informed decisions that shape the future of the division.


 * Protection Plan warranty costs (total / trends, by product and by dealer)
 * Protection Plan monthly/quarterly sales reporting
 * Protection Plan pricing (compare to other industries)
 * Trimble warranty costs by dealer, as a percent of sales to the dealer
 * Travel costs by GS employee
 * Product quality analysis using service/support data from various sources
 * Warranty cost trends by account and by product
 * Analyze product data gathered through telemetry to drive predictive service/support actions
   
   

What Skills & Experience You Should Bring


 * BS or BA degree in a quantitative discipline or three years of experience in a role with quantitative analysis responsibilities and deliverables
 * Experience with SQL, data visualization and programming languages for effective manipulation, extraction, analysis and modeling of data
 * Experience with DOMO or a similar Business Intelligence system
 * Understanding of statistical concepts and techniques to analyze and draw meaningful insights to enable informed decision making
 * Proficient in working with imperfect or incomplete data, transforming it into meaningful insights, and driving continuous improvements in data quality
 * Excellent collaboration skills to work with many different internal teams to understand the outcomes they are trying to achieve and assist them with translating data insights into strategies to achieve these outcomes
 * Intellectual curiosity, coupled with a passion for problem solving
 * Skill in facilitating understanding of data analysis and trends to varying levels of the organization, among both technical and non-technical stakeholders

title: Data Analyst

description:
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), one of the world’s leading financial groups. Across the globe, we’re 120,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.

With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.

Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.

The selected colleague will work at an MUFG office or client sites four days per week and work remotely one day. A member of our recruitment team will provide more details.

Job Summary

Working as a member of the Office of the Chief Data Officer (OCDO), Enterprise Data Quality Team (EDQ), responsible for enabling the efficient and actionable use of data by planning, developing, and implementing enterprise data controls across systems within the Bank with a focus on Risk and Regulatory Reporting under the Data Management Integrated Control Framework (DMICF). Acting as Golden Source Identification and Certification (GSIC) Data Quality Analyst for Agile systems development lifecycle projects, work with a broad range of teams and roles across the organization including teams such as Office of the Chief Data Officer, Americas Risk Management, and Regulatory Reporting as well as roles such as Report Content Owners, Business System Owners, System Managers, project business sponsors, business and technical Subject Matter Expert resources within multiple MUFG entities, project manager, project leads, and IT. This role will further support Data Quality Leads with data analysis, support onboarding efforts for new control points, and support any ongoing monthly collection and reporting process.

Key Responsibilities


 * Implement control structures to ensure the accuracy and quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels
 * Maintain the data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to our policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools, and data architecture
 * Ensure that data-related business requirements for protecting sensitive data are communicated, well understood, considered as part of operational prioritization and planning
 * Participate in and contribute to data source identification (lineage), data mapping, functional design and detail design
 * Support Root Cause Analysis / investigation activities and document results
 * Ensure adherence to enterprise data standards, quality, and monitoring processes
 * Support project documentation reviews and testing activities at all levels to include reviews of test plans, test cases, and test scripts; triage and support fixes as necessary.
 * Identify gaps between current capabilities and new requirements, document design improvements, etc.
 * Determine data domains, identify in scope key data elements, assessment of rules required and expected.
 * Defining data quality rules across dimensions that data must conform to.
 * Identify and recommend new ways to streamline business processes
 * Research, analyze, and interpret source data as necessary to fulfill business requirements
 * Implement control structures to ensure the accuracy and quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels
 * Maintain the data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to our policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools, and data architecture
 * Ensure that data-related business requirements for protecting sensitive data are communicated, well understood, considered as part of operational prioritization and planning Work with business partners to provide reports as directed
 * Participate in and contribute to data source identification (lineage), data mapping, functional design and detail design
 * Ensure adherence to enterprise data standards, quality, and monitoring processes
 * Support project documentation reviews and testing activities at all levels to include reviews of test plans, test cases, and test scripts; triage and support fixes as necessary.
 * Identify gaps between current capabilities and new requirements, document design improvements, etc.
 * Understand and apply familiarity with Risk and Regulatory Reporting processes and Enterprise Metadata concepts such as Key Data Elements, Business Information Model, Report Attributes, Data Attributes, Physical Location, etc.
 * Performing data analysis including data extraction with standard SQL Tools.
 * Writing and executing queries to profile large data sets.
 * Support creation of various project related documentation (including but not limited to BRDs, DRDs, Test plans, Test Scripts, etc.)
   
   

Education


 * Degree or equivalent work experience equally preferable
   
   

Work Experience/Functional Skills


 * Some data quality or similar level data analysis experience required
 * Experience in the banking or finance institutions preferred
 * Knowledge of industry leading data quality and data protection management practices
 * Knowledge of data-related government regulatory requirements and emerging trends and issues
 * Knowledge of risk data architecture and technology solutions
 * Knowledge of relevant laws, legal codes, government regulations, agency rules, and current industry practices
 * Knowledge of computer software, including relevant applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
 * Experience with formulation of business analytics
 * Familiar with database management tools (e.g., Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server)
 * Familiar with data modeling tools
 * Familiar with data visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Collibra Data Quality)
 * Ability to design processes that make up a data system, and influence engineering and product directions
 * Ability to interact with external database administrators, data engineers, product managers, business stakeholders, and technology leaders
 * Ability to analyze large datasets
 * Ability to write high level technical specifications and comprehensive reports
   
   

Technical Skills


 * Data Analysis, Data Query skills, Data Science
 * Tableau, Alteryx or any other BI tool
 * SQL, Python
 * Amazon Web Services a plus
 * Collibra Data Quality a plus
 * Excel Macro a plus
   
   

The typical base pay range for this role is between $89K - $9K depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and location. This role may also be eligible for certain discretionary performance-based bonus and/or incentive compensation. Additionally, our Total Rewards program provides colleagues with a competitive benefits package (in accordance with the eligibility requirements and respective terms of each) that includes comprehensive health and wellness benefits, retirement plans, educational assistance and training programs, income replacement for qualified employees with disabilities, paid maternity and parental bonding leave, and paid vacation, sick days, and holidays. For more information on our Total Rewards package, please click the link below.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Who We Are:

The Bliss Group is a data driven marketing communications firm that is centered on strong values and a commitment to training you to accelerate your personal career development. Our continued growth is opening up new opportunities for all levels within our firm, particularly in healthcare, technology, financial and professional services and social purpose. We are always looking for team members who are passionate about our industry, our clients and making a difference in our society.

Position Overview:

Seeking a Senior Analyst to join our growing Research & Analytics (R&A) team. This role is an exciting opportunity to take the lead on research projects, provide data-driven insights and stories, and collaborate across teams to drive measurable results for our clients across a variety of industries. The Senior Analyst will play a key role in designing and executing on research & analytics projects, mentoring junior team members, creating firm-wide educational materials, and supporting the continued growth of our R&A capabilities and internal infrastructure.

This position is ideal for someone with 2-5 years of research and analytics experience who is passionate about uncovering insights, solving complex challenges, and contributing to integrated marketing and PR strategies.

Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:


 * This role will include independently and successfully driving workstreams or pieces of a client’s business related to research and analytics services/offerings (ex: competitor audits, social media analysis, white space analysis)
 * Serve as an account team’s “go-to” lead Analyst who will be involved in every step of the research process from identification of request to methodology creation to data collection to analysis to execution and recommendations
 * Being knowledgeable on general client issues, industry trends, and audience needs for your assigned client teams
 * Serve as a subject matter expertise on data analysis, marketing research, and insight generation including ethical data collection, privacy concerns, and optimization of AI
 * Having strong presentation and communication skills both internally within the agency and externally to clients
 * Leveraging a solutions-oriented approach to internal client service and is proactive about addressing research opportunities/weaknesses in a constructive way
 * Manage and coach junior R&A employees and potential interns
 * Develop research documents or slide decks independently that include a valid methodology, clear narrative, data-driven insights, and client recommendations
 * Support organic growth and new business initiatives across the firm and sister agencies
 * Serve as a co-project manager, helping track team bandwidth and revenue for all clients
 * Leverage account management skills to help organize and manage internal infrastructure, maintain/manage client relationships, and present client deliverables
 * Flexible approach: has the ability to change priorities against changing client and team needs
 * Intellectual curiosity, a passion for learning about a rapidly evolving industry, and a positive attitude!
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as data analytics, marketing, business, business analytics, or information technology
 * 2–5 years of experience in research, analytics, or related roles; agency or consulting firm experience strongly preferred
 * Experience using or quick ability to learn data analysis and business intelligence tools is a must (SQL, Excel, Talkwalker/Meltwater/Brandwatch/Sprinklr)
 * Coding experience not necessary, but a nice to have (Java, Python)
 * Strong written and verbal communication skills, with experience in turning data into compelling narratives
 * Demonstrated ability to manage client relationships and deliver data-driven recommendations
 * Understanding of integrated marketing and PR strategies, including familiarity with deliverables such as trend reports, media audits, social intelligence reports, and competitor audits
 * Exceptional organizational and project management skills with a proven ability to prioritize and manage deadlines in a fast-paced environment
 * Intellectual curiosity and a passion for translating data into actionable insights that drive business outcomes
   
   

Work location: In person (hybrid - 3 days/week in office) - New York, NY

Bliss Benefits & Perks: (Only applicable to full time salaried employees)

Competitive Compensation Package including Bonus & Incentive Opportunities

Robust Benefits Program: medical, dental, vision, FSA, HSA, disability, employer-paid life & disability insurance, commuter benefits, college savings plan (529), employee discounts

401k Retirement Plan with Company Match

Generous Time Off: Flexible PTO Days + Company Holidays including office closure between Christmas and New Year's

FlexTime

Hybrid work schedule

Convenient Midtown Office Location

Great Company Culture. Collaborative, friendly, supportive, of high integrity. We highly value our colleagues.

title: Senior Analyst, Research & Analytics

description:
Posting Description

SENIOR DATA ANALYST, MIT Energy Initiative , to serve as key advisor to the Institute for Innovation Fellow (IIF) to lead research, analysis, and develop data tools on economic and climate policy topics, including competition, tax policy, clean energy, sustainability, and industrial/manufacturing policy; build and maintain the GCIM database by compiling and analyzing data on global clean energy subsidies; collaborate with MIT CEEPR and the Rhodium Group to produce and update original research for the GCIM; design and build data architecture, pipelines, and products to address policy data problems; support drafting and publishing research papers, working papers, op-eds, and other written products; present findings clearly to the team; participate in public-facing research projects by preparing talking points and materials. The position reports to the Public Sector Data Manager and focuses on the Global Clean Energy Investment Monitor (GCIM), a joint project with MIT’s Center for Energy and Environmental Research and the Rhodium Group.

Job Requirements

REQUIRED: Bachelor’s degree and minimum seven years of experience in data analysis, including collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and synthesizing complex datasets; at least 4 years of research experience in government or public policy; exceptional data analysis skills, including Excel; excellent written and verbal communication skills; experience advising senior officers; demonstrated organizational and collaborative abilities. Experience with data transformation and analysis in Python and experience with Git and GitHub/GitLab, preferred. Job #24718-10

title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
Position Overview

Are you passionate about solving complex puzzles and problems? Do you get excited by business data sets and analyzing data from the Internet of Things? Alarm.com is a rapidly expanding, entrepreneurial technology company that is seeking an individual that is ambitious, hardworking, has strong academic qualifications, and proven experience in a dynamic team environment to become a Data Analyst.

This position will be the main point of contact for the business reporting needs for our Finance department, helping to prioritize and deliver reports and analysis to support this critical function.

Few companies innovate across as broad of a range of technologies as Alarm.com. To be successful in this role, we are seeking a highly motivated person that adapts well to change and can easily navigate multiple priorities in a matrixed organization. This role will have a huge impact on data availability through turning data into insight that will help drive business decisions.

Responsibilities


 * Develop and automate reports, solving the Business Intelligence (BI) and analytical needs of our full range of Finance stakeholders. Collaborate with these stakeholders to establish the right metrics for monitoring the business.
 * Gather functional requirements and work with engineering teams to help deliver data driven business value to propel our growing suite of products and services.
 * Leverage business and industry knowledge to assist in internal initiatives from ideation to launch, participating in multiple areas of the project to ensure successful execution in pursuit of business objectives.
 * Evaluate addressable market opportunities in partnership with our Finance and strategy teams, incorporating data from multiple sources to quantify current and future market/growth opportunities.
 * Communicate findings on a regular basis to all levels of business and management.
 * Help train internal and external stakeholders in utilizing reporting tools and analyzing results.
 * Set standards for data management and conceive projects needed to eliminate gaps between current state and future goals.
 * Other duties as assigned.
   
   
   

Requirements


 * BA/BS in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Finance, Data Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, or relevant technical field. Finance with a math background preferred.
 * Working knowledge of accounting and financial concepts. Experience in a Finance-related business position preferred.
 * 3 years of experience with using SQL for data analysis. Familiarity with other programming languages is a plus.
 * 2 years of experience developing MicroStrategy reports, dashboards/dossiers, and with the MicroStrategy architecture preferred. Experience with other Business Intelligence (BI) tools may be considered.
 * Demonstrated success when working cross-functionally and can translate technical content to a general audience.
 * Understanding of Data Management and the data lifecycle.
 * Excellent written/oral communication and interpersonal skills.
 * Strong problem-solving skills.
 * Willingness to learn new skills and tools and flexibility to accept a wide range of responsibilities in our innovative and entrepreneurial environment.
 * Highly motivated, self-starter that can operate under minimal supervision. Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
   
   
   

WHY WORK FOR ALARM.COM?


 * Collaborate with outstanding people: We hire only the best. Our standards are high and our employees enjoy working alongside other high achievers.
 * Make an immediate impact: New employees can expect to be given real responsibility for bringing new technologies to the marketplace. You are empowered to perform as soon as you join the Alarm.com team!
 * Gain well rounded experience: Alarm.com offers a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with executives and develop expertise across multiple areas of the business.
 * Focus on fun: Alarm.com places high value on our team culture. We even have a committee dedicated to hosting a stand-out holiday party, happy hours, and other fun corporate events.
 * Alarm.com values working together and collaborating in person. Our employees work from the office 4 days a week.
   
   
   

Company Info

Alarm.com is the leading cloud-based platform for smart security and the Internet of Things. More than 7.6 million home and business owners depend on our solutions every day to make their properties safer, smarter, and more efficient. And every day, we’re innovating new technologies in rapidly evolving spaces including AI, video analytics, facial recognition, machine learning, energy analytics, and more. We’re seeking those who are passionate about creating change through technology and who want to make a lasting impact on the world around them.

For more information, please visit www.alarm.com.

Company Benefits

Alarm.com offers competitive pay and benefits inclusive of subsidized medical plan options, an HSA with generous company contribution, a 401(k) with employer match, and paid holidays, wellness time, and vacation increasing with tenure. Paid maternity and bonding leave, company-paid disability and life insurance, FSAs, well-being resources and activities, and a casual dress work environment are also part of our outstanding total rewards package!

Alarm.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer

In connection with your application, we collect information that identifies, reasonably relates to or describes you (“Personal Information”). The categories of Personal Information that we may collect include your name, government-issued identification number(s), email address, mailing address, other contact information, emergency contact information, employment history, educational history, criminal record, and demographic information. We collect and use those categories of Personal Information about you for human resources and other business management purposes, including identifying and evaluating you as a candidate for potential or future employment or future positions, recordkeeping in relation to recruiting and hiring, conducting criminal background checks as permitted by law, conducting analytics, and ensuring compliance with applicable legal requirements and Company policies. By submitting your application, you acknowledge that we may retain some of the personal data that you provide in your application for our internal operations such as managing our recruitment system and ensuring that we comply with labor laws and regulations even after we have made our employment decision.

Notice To Third Party Agencies:

Alarm.com understands the value of professional recruiting services. However, we are not accepting resumes from recruiters or employment agencies for this position. In the event we receive a resume or candidate referral for this position from a third-party recruiter or agency without a previously signed agreement, we reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to you. If you are interested in working with Alarm.com, please email your company information and standard agreement to RecruitingPartnerships@Alarm.com.
